bill_title: revise certain requirements for a legal newspaper.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain requirements for a legal newspaper. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 17-2-2.4 be amended to read: 17-2-2.4. A legal newspaper shall, for at least one year prior to publication of legal and official notices, maintain a known office of publication in the community where its mailing permit of original entry is issued, for the purpose of gathering news, soliciting advertising, and conducting general newspaper business. The terms ", printed", or "published", mean that the newspaper is published where it maintains its known office of publication as described in this section, but no. A newspaper may have more than one place where it is published at the same time. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.167 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Withdrawn at the Request of the Prime Sponsor
